I ordered Green is for Christmas with my $10 reward for November. It was listed as a hardback book, however in the description, it didn't make it clear that it was a mini book. Had I realized that the book was so small, I wouldn't have used my $10 on it. I wanted to read this book to the class, and this mini size is just too small for a variety of reasons. Scholastic needs to make it clear when the book size is smaller than average. It should be noted on the main page that comes up when the book title is clicked.When I contacted Scholastic through the online chat about this, I was given bonus points. Although I appreciate this, the points are not enough to compensate for a $10 book. When I questioned this, I was told that if I wanted to return the book I could, but I would need to pay shipping. I chose not to do this. I feel that since Scholastic did not make it clear on the main page that comes up when the book title is clicked, I should be given the opportunity to receive $10 in books to compensate for this. It isn't a situation that I ordered incorrectly or just didn't like the book. If that's what happened, I never would have contacted Scholastic. It would have been my mistake. Again, I am appreciative for the bonus points, however I don't feel that the situation was fully rectified.
